title: Our hundred days in Europe;
author: Holmes, Oliver Wendell
snippet: ancestral fellow-countrymen ? There are many memorials in Poets Corner and elsewhere in the Abbey which could be better spared than that.

title: Our hundred days in Europe;
author: Holmes, Oliver Wendell
snippet: I think no part of the Abbey is visited with so much interest as Poets Corner.

title: Our old home, and English note-books;
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel
snippet: Returning to Poets Corner, I looked again at the walls, and wondered how the requisite hospitality can be shown to poets of our own and the succeeding ages.

title: Our old home, and English note-books;
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel
snippet: Another day in truth, many other days I sought out Poets Corner, and found a sign-board and pointed finger directing the visitor to it, on the corner house of a little lane leading towards the rear of the Abbey.

title: Our old home, and English note-books;
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel
snippet: Poets Corner has never seemed like a strange place to me ; it has been famil iar from the very first ; at all events, I cannot now recollect the previous conception, of which the reality has taken the place.
